testcase.brief: Check user-profile-attribute for lan ports ethx with trunk mode
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Laptop1 connect to BR lan ports Lan ports work with trunk mode
Test Procedure:
1. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth1 #interface eth1 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1000 2. Check lan ports lan ports eth1 upid. Result1 3. 4. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth2 #interface eth2 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1001 5. Check lan ports lan ports eth2 upid. Result2 6. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth3 #interface eth3 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1002 7. Check lan ports lan ports eth3 upid. Result3 8. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth4 #interface eth4 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1003 9. Check lan ports lan ports eth4 upid. Result4

step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.2 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.2 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server enable"

-v "interface mgt0.3 vlan ${br1.vpc3.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.3 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.3.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.3 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.3.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.3.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.3 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.3 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.3.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.3 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.3 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.4 vlan ${br1.vpc4.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.4 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.4 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.4 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.4 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.4.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.4 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.4 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: 1. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth1 #interface eth1 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1000
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface eth1 native-vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.desc: If platform is BR100, should change eth1 as access port becuase of bug15388 to avoid the case failed
step.telnet: -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access" -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.desc: Laptop1 connect to lan port eth1

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: 2. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth2 #interface eth2 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1001
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan2 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface eth2 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute ${br1.vpc2.vlan}"

step.desc: add debug info to check some logs because the case is not stable
step.telnet: -v "show lan port-config" -v "show interface eth2 mac-learning all" -v "show route"

step.desc: Laptop2 connect to lan port eth2

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc2.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: 3. Configure user-profile-attribute for lan ports eth3 #interface eth3 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute 1002
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan3 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc3.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc3.vlan}" -v "interface eth3 mode bridge-802.1q user-profile-attribute ${br1.vpc3.vlan}"

step.desc: AP1 connect to lan port eth3
step.console: -v "interface mgt0 vlan ${br1.vpc3.vlan}" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "" -v "" -v "interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "" -v ""
